attributes.action: Stop all unnecessary plastic surgery and treat sick children on the NHS instead
attributes.additional_details: There has been numerous occasions where the Government has granted funding for breast enlargements for personal pleasure. However, myself and a couple friends have to fundraise to send sick children to the United States for treatment because the Government will not fun it. Where is the sense in that ? Stop pleasure treatment and spend the money on making the new generation have happier and healthy lives.
attributes.background: The NHS is a wonderful creation that helps citizens up and down the country. I believe we can make the health service a more happy place for children who really need it.

rejection.details:
Cosmetic surgery is not routinely provided on the NHS, so we're not sure what action you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to take.

Occasionally, cosmetic surgery may be provided on the NHS for psychological or other health reasons.

You can find out more about cosmetic surgery on the NHS here:

https://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/cosmetic-treatments-guide/Pages/is-cosmetic-surgery-available-on-the-NHS.aspx
